meanings.definition: The retention of juvenile characteristics in an adult organism.
meanings.sent1: Pedomorphosis can be seen in some animals where adults still have features of young animals.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study pedomorphosis to understand why some animals keep their youthful traits.
meanings.sent3: The pedomorphosis of the frog made it look like it never grew up!
meanings.sent4: Her pedomorphosis was a reminder of the innocence of childhood in the midst of adulthood.
meanings.sent5: The pedomorphosis of the butterfly was a beautiful display of nature's wonders.

meanings.definition: The process by which an organism reaches sexual maturity while retaining juvenile traits.
meanings.sent1: Pedomorphosis is when an organism grows up but still acts like a kid.
meanings.sent2: The pedomorphosis of certain insects allows them to reproduce while still looking young.
meanings.sent3: The pedomorphosis of the tree made it the most popular among the forest animals!
meanings.sent4: His pedomorphosis was a unique blend of maturity and childlike wonder.
meanings.sent5: The pedomorphosis of the flower was a symbol of growth and innocence intertwined.
